node.title: Concerning levels of heavy metals found in Indigenous people living beside world's biggest manganese-producing mine
node.alt: A mural of Groote Eylandt with a map and a bird on the side of a building as locals walk past.
node.description: Tests on the hair and nails of children and adults living inÂ Angurugu, on Groote Eylandt, have shown "concerning" levels of manganese, according to the local lands council.
node.content:
["High levels of the heavy metal manganese have been detected in people living\u00a0in the Indigenous community of Angurugu, near\u00a0the world's biggest\u00a0manganese mine.", "The Anindilyakwa Land Council, which represents traditional owners on remote Groote Eylandt in the Northern Territory,\u00a0has told the ABC\u00a0the results have come from a study it commissioned eight years ago after becoming worried about the impact of dust from the South32 Gemco mine.", "The land council said it was working with South32, which operates the mine, to reduce dust because of the high levels that were found.", "It said the tests on the hair and nails of children and adults living in\u00a0Angurugu\u00a0showed \"concerning\" levels of manganese.", "The problem only came\u00a0to light because a teacher heard about testing and has raised questions about the long-term impacts of manganese exposure.", "Teacher Jeff Aschmann told the ABC he became concerned while working in the nearby mainland community of Numbulwar, which Groote Eylandt people regularly visit.", "\"I've been very concerned and other people have been very concerned in case there is a major impact on the wellbeing, and particularly the cognitive wellbeing of children and adults,\" he said.", "\"I'm not pointing the finger at anybody but it seems to defy common sense\u00a0that the community lives so close to a working mine;\u00a0I think planning processes have let us down.\"", "", "
Teacher\u00a0Jeff Aschmann first became concerned after learning about the effects of manganese dust on northern quolls.(Supplied)
", "The Gemco manganese mine has been operating beside the Angurugu population of 850 people for 50 years, and about another 12 years of mining are expected.", "The Anindilyakwa Land Council\u00a0receives millions of dollars a year in mining royalties from the South32 Gemco operation on traditional owners\u2019 land.", "The World Health Organization advises breathing in even low levels of manganese can cause damage to brain functions controlling dexterity as well as\u00a0the respiratory and reproductive systems.", "", "
Manganese dust has collected on abandoned cars near the Gemco port loader(ABC News: Jane Bardon)
", "Mr Aschmann said he hoped\u00a0everything was done to determine whether the levels of exposure on Groote Eylandt were harmful.", "\"It's very important we have a good look at that, and if there are problems we've got to fix them,\" he said.", "\"We have to put human beings' wellbeing ahead of the money being derived from this manganese mine.\"", "
'Concerning levels, but no cognitive development impact'
", "The Anindilyakwa Land Council's chief executive, Mark Hewitt, said the organisation commissioned the research after being approached by a non-government organisation,\u00a0which was concerned manganese may have been affecting the learning abilities of local children.", "\"So the land council instigated a scientific study on that with the University of Queensland, who'd already been doing other studies of the animals here, particularly the northern quoll,\" he said.", "\"They came and they measured levels of manganese in children and adults;\u00a0it was a large study, and they also tested the other communities as well.", "\"But what they found was there was no indication that it had an impact on cognitive development at all.\"", "Mr Hewitt said the research on the community could not yet be released to the ABC because it hadn't yet been published.", "\"While we don't like that that is being absorbed into people who are living in the vicinity of where there is manganese, I need to say that manganese is there whether there's mining or not \u2014\u00a0it's just in the soil, it's just a feature of the landscape here,\" he said.", "
Manganese had effect on quolls
", "The University of Queensland's 2018 research on northern quolls living within 20 kilometres of\u00a0the mine\u00a0was what first alerted\u00a0Mr Aschmann\u00a0to the impact of manganese exposure.", "\"The study on spotted quolls shows us that the manganese dust isn't in the best interest of spotted quolls, so there's a big worry that there would be some impact on the people living in close proximity to the mine,\" he said.", "", "
A 2018 study into the effect of manganese dust on northern quolls found it had reduced their agility and speed.(Supplied: TSR Hub/Nicolas Rakotopare)
", "The study found the animals had elevated manganese concentrations within their hair, testes, and the neocortex and cerebellum brain regions, which are responsible for sensory perception and motor function.", "\"Fine manganese dust within the respirable size range is found at levels exceeding international recommendations even 20km from manganese extraction, processing and storage facilities on Groote Eylandt,\" the researchers reported.", "The study concluded manganese in the quolls had reduced their agility and speed, and could affect their reproductive success.", "
'Measures have significantly reduced dust'
", "Mr Hewitt said, rather than continue to fund the research, the land council decided to work with the mining company to find and fund solutions to the dust problem.", "\"South32, to their credit, immediately embarked on extensive measures to prevent their manganese dust entering into the communities, which are in proximity to mining activities, and that work has been going on for three to four years, and it has definitely made a significant reduction,\" he said.", "Mr Hewitt said the company had\u00a0also set up dust monitors in the community.", "\"When there is a high dust exceedence of what we consider to be acceptable, we find out the reason for that \u2014\u00a0often its due to the wind changing,\" he said.", "\"They've also looked at avoiding the use of machinery close to the community when the wind conditions are not correct.\"", "", "
Anindilyakwa Land Council chairman Tony Wurramarrba said\u00a0the community and the mine\u00a0have put in place a series of measures to reduce dust.(ABC News: Jane Bardon)
", "Council\u00a0chairman Tony Wurramarrba said the land council and local government council were also carrying out their own works around the communities to reduce dust, including planting more trees and grass.", "\"The East Arnhem Regional Council are now doing major roadworks, putting kerbings on the road and we intend to green our communities \u2014\u00a0that will help reduce the amount of dust that goes around the community,\" he said.", "South32's head of external affairs, Liam Stower, told the ABC the company had\u00a0reduced the amount of dust blowing off the mine by continuously spraying the site with water trucks.", "", "
Manganese ore is loaded onto ships at the Gemco port at Alyangula.(ABC News: Jane Bardon)
", "He said it had\u00a0also contributed financially to sealing the main road around Angurugu to help reduce dust coming off dirt roads.", "\"One of the first things we did was understand where potential areas of uptake could be and we redesigned a lot of our mining area to accommodate that and we prioritised revegetating the bushland around Angurugu to make sure it's got that natural dust screening,\" he said.", "Mr Stower said the company's dust monitoring showed it was\u00a0not breaching national air quality guidelines.", "\"That monitoring has shown that the ambient dust in the community of Angurugu is below the National Environmental Protection Measure, the NEPM guidelines, so that gives us a high level of confidence about the health and wellbeing of our community,\" he said.", "The Northern Territory Environment Protection Authority (EPA) does not have independent air quality measurement stations on Groote Eylandt.", "In a recent assessment of the risk posed by dust from the mine for an expansion onto some eastern leases, the EPA said the mine's land management air quality measures \u2014 dust suppression, watering of haul roads and rehabilitation of disturbed areas \u2014 were \"appropriate.\"", "The Northern Territory Health Department told the ABC it was not aware of the manganese exposure issue.", "
Previous manganese exposure research
", "It's not the first time research has been carried out into the effects of manganese exposure on the Groote Eylandt population.", "CSIRO land and water scientist Jenny Stauber analysed hair and blood samples in the 1980s.", "\"We found that the Aboriginal people in Angurugu had about 20 times more manganese in hair close to their scalp than someone living in Sydney had,\" she said.", "", "
CSIRO Land and Water scientist Jenny Stauber said samples taken in the 1980s had revealed\u00a0Aboriginal people in Angurugu had high levels of manganese exposure.(Supplied)
", "\"We also found that they had two to six times higher concentrations in their blood compared to the non-Indigenous people who lived in the township.\"", "Dr Stauber said her research showed the high manganese levels had not just come from mine dust, but also because local Aboriginal people were eating more locally grown vegetables and bush tucker.", "\"Their vegetables were grown in high manganese-enriched soil, manganese outcrops surface on Groote Eylandt in many places,\" she said.", "\"Yams, for example, have high manganese;\u00a0the billy tea that they used to drink was very high in manganese as well.", "She said to get accurate data on the level of manganese in peoples' bodies it was important to test the bit of the hair closest to the scalp, because hair quickly absorbs manganese through dust\u00a0blood testing also provides limited information.", "\"When manganese gets into the body, it gets cleared from blood fairly quickly, and can end up in organs, such as the liver and brain;\u00a0manganese in blood doesn't give you an indication of long-term body burdens and long-term exposure to manganese.\"", "According to the US National Institutes of Health, manganese is an essential trace element that is naturally present in many foods and available as a dietary supplement. It plays a role in enzyme and bone formation, reproduction, immune response and blood clotting.", "Deficiency is very rare in humans, but manganese toxicity has occurred in among certain occupations\u00a0through chronic inhalation of manganese dust or by consuming tainted water. This mainly affects the central nervous system and can cause tremors, muscle spasms, tinnitus, hearing loss, and the feeling of being unsteady on one's feet. Additional symptoms include mania, insomnia, depression, delusions, anorexia, headaches, irritability, lower extremity weakness, changes in mood and short-term memory, altered reaction times, and reduced hand-eye coordination."]
